gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: International Surface Temperature Initiative (ISTI) Global Land Surface Temperature Databank - Stage 1 Daily

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce
International Surface Temperature Initiative

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: International Surface Temperature Initiative Home Page

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: International Surface Temperature Initiative Home Page

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: International Surface Temperature Initiative

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: International Surface Temperature Initiative Home Page

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: International Surface Temperature Initiative Home Page

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The global land surface temperature databank contains monthly timescale mean, max, and min temperature for approximately 40,000 stations globally. It was developed as part of the International Surface Temperature Initiative. This is the global repository for all monthly timescale land surface observations from the 1800s to present and uses data deriving from sub-daily, daily, and monthly observations. It brings together data from more than 45 sources and is used in the creation of various integrated global temperature resources, most notably Global Historical Climatology Network Monthly (GHCN-M) v4. Daily Data is purposefully provided as raw, non-homogenized observations with no integrated quality control performed. Data are submitted as-is from the data provider to ensure absolute data integrity and visibility of the data.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Stage 1 Daily data will be standardized and used in the production of Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCN) products. This data will also be made available so that other scientists and research organizations can use the data to create new temperature products as needed.

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: ISTI/Global Surface Temperature Databank FTP site

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: ISTI/Global Surface Temperature Databank FTP site

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Not all sources have full coverage for time period available.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString:
The global databank aims to be a repository for original raw climate observations that have not been subjected to quality control or homogeneity adjustments. If only quality controlled or bias corrected data are available, providers are requested to provide information on the procedures used and relevant flagging schemes associated with each observation.
The highest priority is collection of temperature data on Daily and Monthly timescales. The databank hosts also would like to collect precipitation data and other elements as well as data collected on sub-daily timescales (e.g., hourly) if they are available.
The data is provided in the original native format. Examples of possible formats include ASCII text, Microsoft Excel, XML, NetCDF, and any other used to originally digitize the raw observations.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Data received and accepted for inclusion in the Stage 1 level of the ISTI databank; no changes or re-formatting occurs at this stage

gmd:rationale.gco:CharacterString: Data is accepted as is: there is a risk in asking providers to change formats because changes may introduce an error that then becomes invisible to both us and end-users. To ensure provenance, it is important to keep data processing visible from start to finish.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCDC > National Climatic Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce
DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCDC > National Climatic Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Bulk metadata change applied on 2018-05-25. See version control repository history for metadata change details.
